item.title: 阿尔·戈尔称特朗普阻挠海上风电建设是“疯狂之举”
item.description: 前美国副总统、Generation投资管理公司董事长阿尔·戈尔表示，特朗普总统阻挠海上风电场的举措违背常理。【原文：Al Gore, the chairman of Generation Investment Management and a former US vice president, said President Donald Trump’s efforts to block offshore wind farms defy logic.】

item.title: 债券买家预计将投入400亿美元应对严峻污染问题
item.description: 过渡债券旨在为全球污染最严重的行业减排提供资金支持，预计今年将取得进展。尽管气候议题面临广泛反对，但可持续金融工具的整体市场仍逆势而上。【原文：Transition bonds, intended to finance emissions reduction in the world’s heaviest-polluting industries, are forecast to advance this year as the overall market for sustainable instruments defies a wider climate backlash.】

item.title: 寒潮来袭前中国液化天然气价格上涨
item.description: 一股来自北极的寒流本周正使中国各地气温急剧下降，这助推了液化天然气价格上涨，并促使当局发布严寒天气预警。【原文：An Arctic blast is driving temperatures sharply lower across China this week, helping buoy liquefied natural gas prices and prompting authorities to issue warnings about freezing weather.】

item.title: 奥瑞金将关闭澳大利亚最大燃煤电厂，距其投运仅两年
item.description: 澳大利亚能源公司将推迟关闭该国最大燃煤电厂的计划近两年，以确保在可再生能源发电逐步投入运营期间维持稳定的能源供应。【原文：Origin Energy Ltd. will delay the retirement of Australia’s largest coal-fired power station by almost two years to ensure stable energy supply through the roll-out of renewable generation.】

item.title: 东欧地区将持续严寒天气至二月初
item.description: 异常寒冷的天气预计将持续笼罩欧洲东北部和中部地区直至二月初，这将推高供暖需求，并考验波动性较大的天然气市场。【原文：Unusually cold conditions are forecast to linger across northeastern and central Europe through early February, boosting heating demand and testing volatile gas markets.】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告：银行忽视转型风险将自食其果
item.description: 今日《绿色日报》还报道：达沃斯论坛淡化气候变化问题，中国煤炭产量创历史新高。【原文：Also in today’s Green Daily: Davos downplays climate change and China’s coal production hits a record.】

item.title: 回购市场已开始计入能源转型风险
item.description: 多年来，气候专家一直坚称，随着风险日益显现，市场将自然推动企业更重视气候变化问题。最新研究表明，借款人如今开始因忽视未来风险而面临财务惩罚。【原文：For years, climate experts have insisted that markets will naturally push companies to take climate change more seriously as risks become more apparent. Fresh research indicates that borrowers are now starting to face a financial penalty for ignoring the dangers ahead.】

item.title: 莫桑比克总统查波取消达沃斯之行，因洪水已造成数十人死亡
item.description: 莫桑比克总统丹尼尔·查波取消了赴达沃斯参加世界经济论坛的行程，此前该南部非洲国家发生洪灾，造成数十人死亡，数万栋房屋受损或被毁。【原文：Mozambican President Daniel Chapo canceled a trip to the World Economic Forum in Davos after floods in the southern African nation killed dozens of people and left tens of thousands of houses damaged or destroyed.】

item.title: 南非因致命洪水宣布进入国家灾难状态
item.description: 南非因恶劣天气导致全国多地发生致命洪灾，宣布进入国家灾难状态。【原文：South Africa declared a national disaster after severe weather conditions led to deadly floods across parts of the country.】

item.title: 纽约市大雪覆盖道路，周日航空出行陷入混乱
item.description: 纽约市及东北部地区将迎来一场小雪，这场由两股移动缓慢的降水系统带来的降雪，已导致地区机场逾百架次航班取消。【原文：New York City and the Northeast will get a shallow blanket of snow from two slow moving waves of precipitation that have already lead to more than 100 flights being canceled at regional airports.】

item.title: 尽管在法庭上屡遭败诉，特朗普仍在离岸风电之战中取得胜利
item.description:
总统对该行业的打击行动危及未来项目，甚至在美国三位法官阻止政府施工禁令执行之前便是如此。【原文：

The president's campaign against the industry threatened future projects, even before three US judges blocked enforcement of a government construction ban.

】

item.title: 特朗普正推动天然气为人工智能热潮提供动力，但建设工厂需要数年时间
item.description:
为加快新建能源电厂的建设进度，特朗普政府呼吁举行紧急电力拍卖。他们倾向于天然气、煤炭和核能。

【原文：

To speed the construction of new energy plants, the Trump administration called for an emergency power auction. They favor gas, coal and nuclear.

】

item.title: 美国最大电网为本周末即将到来的极地寒流做准备
item.description:
美国东北部和中西部地区未来数周将持续遭遇寒流侵袭，电网运营商已就此发出供暖需求激增的预警。【原文：

Bouts of cold weather are set to hit the US Northeast and Midwest repeatedly for weeks, prompting grid operators to warn of increased heating demand.

】

item.title: 汽车制造商试图以低于3.5万美元的电动汽车吸引美国消费者
item.description: 可负担性。这似乎是所有人关心的问题，包括（尤其是？）美国购车者。对于精打细算的消费者而言，传统上他们不得不选择燃油车，尤其是在去年联邦税收抵免政策终止之后。【原文：Affordability. It’s on seemingly everyone’s mind, including (especially?) US car buyers. For bargain shoppers looking, buyers have traditionally had to turn to gas-powered vehicles, especially with the death of federal tax credits last year.】

item.title: 欧盟拟通过《欧洲制造法》遏制工业衰退
item.description: 欧盟即将提出一系列新条件，确保在成员国和外国企业作出投资决策时优先考虑本土企业，这颠覆了数十年来主导政策的自由贸易理念。【原文：The European Union is set to propose a swathe of new conditions to ensure local companies are prioritized when investment decisions are made in the region by member-states and foreign firms, upending a free-trade philosophy that has governed decades of policy.】

item.title: 特朗普治下美国如何放弃共同气候行动
item.description: 过去三年是有记录以来最热的年份，期间发生了造成人员伤亡和巨大损失的野火与洪灾。尽管科学家警告全球变暖速度正在加快，但唐纳德·特朗普总统却加剧了其退出全球减排合作的步伐。【原文：The past three years have been the hottest on record, marked by deadly and costly wildfires and flooding. Even as scientists warn that the pace of global warming is accelerating, President Donald Trump has escalated his retreat from global cooperation to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 法官裁定多米尼恩能源公司可重启美国叫停的风电项目
item.description: 联邦法官裁定，多米尼恩能源公司可在弗吉尼亚州近海重启风电项目建设，同时继续就特朗普政府下令叫停该110亿美元开发项目一事进行法律诉讼。【原文：Dominion Energy Inc. can restart construction of a wind project off the coast of Virginia while it continues a legal fight over the Trump administration’s order to stop the $11 billion development, a federal judge ruled.】

item.title: 特朗普推动紧急电力拍卖以支持人工智能热潮
item.description: 特朗普政府与多个州提出一项计划，旨在迫使科技公司实质性资助新建发电厂，以此抑制飙升的消费者公用事业账单，同时助力数据中心发展。【原文：The Trump administration and several states laid out a plan intended to compel technology companies to effectively fund the construction of new power plants as a way to tame surging consumer utility bills while aiding the development of data centers.】

item.title: 气候变化暴露了家庭保险的重大缺口
item.description: 房屋保险对于灾后重建至关重要。然而，越来越多的房主发现，保险赔付金额可能不足以重建家园。【原文：Home insurance is essential for recovering after disaster hits. But, as an increasing number of homeowners are finding out, payouts may not be enough to rebuild.】

item.title: 洛杉矶火灾幸存者遭遇粗暴对待，更多美国人可能面临同样遭遇
item.description:
许多家庭保险政策无法覆盖灾后重建的全部费用，随着气候变化影响的加剧，这一问题预计将日益严重。 

【原文：

Many home insurance policies don’t cover the full cost of rebuilding after a disaster, a problem that’s set to grow along with the impacts of climate change. 

】

item.title: 尽管美国补贴政策终止，廉价电动SUV仍可能影响消费者购买决策
item.description:
日产、通用等车企正推出定价策略旨在抵消美国绿色激励政策终止影响的新车型。【原文：

Nissan, GM and others are launching new models with a price tag designed to offset the end of green incentives in the US.

】

item.title: 至少26年来最严重洪水导致克鲁格国家公园关闭，数十人死亡
item.description: 南非关闭了其旗舰克鲁格国家公园，此前该保护区大片区域遭遇了至少2000年以来最严重的洪水侵袭。这场区域性灾难已造成该国东北部及邻国莫桑比克数十人死亡，凸显了灾情的严重性。【原文：South Africa shut its flagship Kruger National Park after the worst flooding since at least 2000 inundated large areas of the reserve, underscoring the severity of a regional disaster that has killed dozens in the northeast of the nation and neighboring Mozambique.】

item.title: 华尔街对股市表现最佳板块意见分歧
item.description: 在地区地缘政治紧张局势加剧的背景下，能源股的强劲涨势持续跑赢大盘，引发了关于这波涨势能持续多久的讨论。【原文：A market-beating rally in energy stocks amid flaring geopolitical tensions has sparked a debate about how long the momentum will last.】

item.title: 中国修订电池法规，电动报废车浪潮迫在眉睫
item.description: 中国宣布出台新规追踪旧车电池，以防止其被非法回收，因为该国正面临日益增多的电动报废车问题。【原文：China announced new rules to track old car batteries to prevent them from being recycled illegally as the country faces a growing number of electric clunkers.】

item.title: 研究发现贸易冲击可能导致英国9万个绿色就业岗位消失
item.description: 一份新报告警告称，英国在实现气候目标方面过度依赖中国，若全球供应链遭受冲击，该国清洁能源行业恐将面临大规模失业风险。【原文：Britain risks widespread job losses across the clean-energy sector if global supply chains are hit by shocks, according to a new report that warns the country is too reliant on China for its climate ambitions.】

item.title: 私募股权公司NGP斥资2亿美元押注美国电池产业，人工智能推动电力需求激增
item.description: 私募股权公司NGP能源资本管理公司正向一家美国新兴储能开发商注资2亿美元，因数据中心推动电力需求创纪录增长。【原文：Private equity firm NGP Energy Capital Management is backing a new US energy-storage developer with $200 million as data centers spur record power demand growth.】

item.title: 格蕾塔的祖国瑞典在气候问题上临阵退缩
item.description: 环保活动家格蕾塔·通贝里（Greta Thunberg）的祖国瑞典，曾是绿色政策和清洁能源转型的坚定支持者。如今已非如此。【原文：Activist Greta Thunberg’s home country Sweden was once a stalwart for green policies and the clean energy transition. Not anymore.】

item.title: 为何气候友好型牛肉标签未能达标
item.description:
一项由环保非营利组织进行的研究发现，牛肉生产商未能为其环保主张提供充分证据。【原文：

A study by an environmental nonprofit found beef producers aren’t providing enough evidence for their green assertions.

】

item.title: 特朗普的稀土政策为绿色科技行业提供救命稻草
item.description:
2025年，随着美国着手构建对国防和能源领域至关重要的元素供应链，该行业获得了创纪录的资金投入。【原文：

The industry saw record funding in 2025 as the US looks to build out a supply chain of elements crucial to the defense and energy sectors.

】

item.title: 嘉吉航运负责人称油价低迷使减排更难实现
item.description: 商品巨头嘉吉公司货运贸易业务总裁表示，疲软的油价正使航运业脱碳进程举步维艰。【原文：Weak oil prices are making it harder for the shipping industry to decarbonize, according to the president of commodities giant Cargill Inc.’s freight-trading business.】
